original: EKEBERG, Emil, Disponent, Sonnarp, f i Sörml 19/8 78. KTH. Driftsing sockerfabr Arlöv o Lund, v Konga AB Sulfitfabr Konga 12, disp dta AB 19. Disp E har infört ny metod f blekn o löst problem att använda andra träslag än gran f cellulosatillverkningen.
translated: EKEBERG, Emil, Managing Director, Sonnarp, born in Sörmland on August 19, 1878. Graduate of the Royal Institute of Technology. Operational manager at Arlöv and Lund sugar factories, and at Konga AB Sulfitfabr Konga 12. Became managing director at AB in 1919. Emil introduced a new method for bleaching and solved the problem of using other types of wood than spruce for cellulose production purposes.

structured.name: Emil Ekeberg
structured.description: Emil Ekeberg was a Swedish managing director and innovator in the field of cellulose production. He introduced a new method for bleaching and successfully solved the problem of using alternative wood types, other than spruce, in cellulose production.
